intro: Jaubertia putorioides, commonly known as the rock fig, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible fig-like fruits that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
